page.title: 17PERTH NEWS:16_21 JUNE,1985
page.content: {1}St.Johnstone,Perth's football team, appoint Ian Gibson as a new manager. {2}Guinness,the Irish brewers, make a Â£375m. bid to take over Bell's Whisky. {3}British Rail must give a Perth man his job back after he had thrown a bucket at a colleague. {4}Perth is being considered for the new Bank of Scotland Headquarters, providing 500 jobs.{ {5}Drunk beggars have been giving Perth a bad name. {6}Perth Theatre will be the most beautiful in Scotland after current renovation. {7}G.R.I.Ltd.(an electronics company) have forecast more jobs at their Perth factory. {8}A new "Pizzaland" restaurant has been opened in Perth. {9}A hypnotist is performing in Perth at Â£2 per ticket.
